description: From Middle English evidently, evydently; equivalent to evident +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: evidently (comparative more evidently, superlative most evidently)

entries.meaning: In a manner which makes the fact or conclusion evident; obviously; as may be clearly inferred. [from 17th c.]
(obsolete) In such a way as to be clearly visible or manifest; distinctly, clearly. [14th–19th c.]
